title: Walking Dead actor who plays Negan hits out as Primark pulls TV show T-shirt after claims of 'racism'
text:

A Walking Dead actor has slammed a 'stupid' controversy over a T-shirt based on his character pulled from the shelves over claims it was racist. 
Primark withdrew the clothing, printed with the words "eeny meeny miny moe" and a picture of a bloodied baseball bat wrapped in barbed wire, after a customer complained about "subliminal messages". 
Jeffrey Dean Morgan, who plays villain Negan in the TV horror drama, tweeted a link to a news story about the furore, adding: "Holy crap people are stupid". 
His character carries a bat called Lucille and utters the words from the children's rhyme while selecting his victims in the final episode of the programme's sixth series. The offending T-shirt has been withdrawn from Primark stores over claims it is racist 
Primark removed the shirts from its shops following a complaint from Methodist minister Ian Lucraft, who wrote to the company's chief executive. 
He told the Sheffield Star : "We were shocked when we came face to face with a new T-shirt with a racially explicit graphic and text. 
"It was fantastically offensive and I can only assume that no-one in the process of ordering it knew what they were doing or were aware of its subliminal messages. 
"The slogan is “Eeeny meenie miny moe.” It stops there, but of course we all know what the original said: “catch a n****r by his toe." 
He added: "The graphic has a large American baseball bat, wrapped round with barbed wire, and covered with blood. This image relates directly to the practice of assaulting black people in America. 
"It is directly threatening of a racist assault, and if I were black and were faced by a wearer I would know just where I stood." 
In the Walking Dead scene, the word 'tiger' is used instead of the N-word. Read More Sweatshop Britain: Workers 'are paid £3 an hour in UK factories supplying high street stores' An offended shopper complained after spotting a 'racist' Walking Dead t-shirt in Primark (Photo: AMC/The Walking Dead) 
"Eeny meeny miny moe" is a popular children's counting rhyme, used to select a person in a variety of games such as tag. 
Its origins are unclear, but it is thought to predate the 19th century. 
While there have been racist versions of the rhyme that include the N word, many others do not. 
Primark's decision to withdraw the T-shirt prompted incredulity among fans of the Walking Dead, with hundreds signing a petition calling for it to be returned to the shelves and some even threatening to boycott the shop. 
A Primark spokesman said: “The T-shirt in question is licensed merchandise for the US television series, The Walking Dead, and the quote and image are taken directly from the show. 
"Any offence caused by its design was wholly unintentional and Primark sincerely apologises for this. 
“Primark is currently removing the product from sale.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
